attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Following the recent conviction and jailing of a British citizen for the ridiculous "offence" of naming a teddy bear mohhamed.
 We call for the British goverment to immediatly cease providing financial aid to Sudan.
In the past three years, more than £326 million of British taxpayers' cash has been given to a country who has jailed a British subject for naming a teddy bear.
A further £114 million is earmarked in the next 12 months.

In 2005 - the most recent figures available - the UK exported goods worth £139 million to Sudan aimed at boosing industry. 
Stop this now,It is our taxes that are
being mispent on a country that shows nothing but contempt for Britain and its subjects.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
